Package com._360t.structured.app.jarcall

Class TwoProcessSocketCallFromJarApp

  • java.lang.Object
    • com._360t.structured.app.App
      • com._360t.structured.app.jarcall.TwoProcessSocketCallFromJarApp
  • public class TwoProcessSocketCallFromJarApp
extends App

    Two Processes Socket Application that should be called through the jar file

    This class is created to run the Player application in the two processes mode. The main idea behind this application class is able to define independent instance of different class types to provide a unified application instance to execute the player application. The player application architecture is based on Observer design pattern by the help of template method and also delegation design pattern.

    Combination of these three pattern make it possible to assemble variety of Processors, Publishers and Subscribers with each other and make a player messaging application without any coupling between different classes and also keep coherence of unified desired business rolls.

    It is simple to create a new player application by a different subscription implementation in Processor, Publisher or Subscriber class. For example it is possible to make a new Processor class by the another implementation of IPC or Inter Process Communication. Imagine we could have a Processor class which utilizing File and new IO channel file to implementing IPC. Or another example is possibility to implement udp socket connection.

    Finally, all of above implementations are possible by assembling different types of classes like: PlayerModel, MessageModel, ProcessorModel, SubscriptionModel, MessageOperationDelegation and MessageProcessTemplate without any obligations to make a change to any of the super classes or change the implementation of concrete classes.

    By the help of these possibilities couple of application classes is created. Application classes like: TwoProcessSocketApp and SingleProcessSubmissionApp.

    Since:
    9/10/2020
    Author:
    MohammadReza Ahmadi
    See Also:
    PlayerModel, MessageModel, ProcessorModel, SubscriptionModel, MessageOperationDelegation, MessageProcessTemplate

      • getPlayerProcess

        private static java.lang.Process getPlayerProcess​(java.lang.Class clazz,
                                                  int port,
                                                  java.lang.String message,
                                                  int messageNumber,
                                                  int delayMilliSeconds,
                                                  java.lang.String jarFileName)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        getPlayerProcess method which receive couple of parameters and create a java process and run the specified runner class
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class type of the specified runner class
        port - The specified port which ServerSocket and Socket instances is initiated based on.
        message - The initiator message value
        messageNumber - The number of messages will be exchange between both players.
        delayMilliSeconds - The delly milliseconds which will be exist between every message transmission.
        jarFileName - The jar file name which this program will execute through that.
        Returns:
        a java.lang.Process instance which responsible to executing passed runner class.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - The exception is throws when an error is occurred.

      • printProcessMessage

        private static void printProcessMessage​(java.lang.Process process)
        Parameters:
        process - of each player or processor execution which will be send to this method to read its input stream.
